question.text: Which of the following is correct with regard to monocot stem?

options.text: Monocot stems have a well-developed collenchymatous hypodermis.
The vascular bundles are surrounded by a sclerenchymatous bundle sheath.
The cortex is differentiated into endodermis and pericycle.
The vascular bundles are conjoint and open.

solution.text: The monocot stem has a sclerenchymatous hypodermis, a large number of scattered vascular bundles, each surrounded by a sclerenchymatous bundle sheath, and a large, conspicuous parenchymatous ground tissue. It doesn't have pericycle. Vascular bundles are conjoint and closed. Peripheral vascular bundles are generally smaller than the centrally located ones.
